workflow.name: Recover Abandoned Shopify Carts with Email Follow-ups, HubSpot CRM & Google Sheets Tracking
workflow.description:
## How it works
The workflow triggers on a new checkout event from Shopify and extracts all relevant cart data. It filters carts based on value and age to isolate qualified abandoned checkouts. For each qualified cart, it sends a follow-up email, updates or creates the corresponding HubSpot contact, and generates a CRM note linked to that contact. Finally, it logs the processed cart into Google Sheets for tracking and review.

## Step-by-step

- **Trigger on new Shopify checkout**  
  - **Shopify Trigger** ‚Äì Starts the workflow when a new checkout is created.

- **Normalize and structure cart data**  
  - **Parse Cart Data** ‚Äì Extracts email, customer name, items, cart totals, timestamps, and hours since creation.

- **Filter carts that meet follow-up criteria**  
  - **Filter Qualified Carts** ‚Äì Passes only carts older than 12 hours and valued above 50.

- **Send follow-up message**  
  - **Send a message** ‚Äì Delivers a reminder email to the customer about the pending checkout.

- **Create or update CRM contact**  
  - **Create or update a contact** ‚Äì Ensures the shopper exists as a HubSpot contact.

- **Prepare CRM note details**  
  - **Generates Note Data** ‚Äì Builds a structured note containing timing, cart details, and follow-up context.

- **Create the HubSpot note**  
  - **Create HubSpot Note** ‚Äì Submits the prepared note to HubSpot‚Äôs CRM.

- **Associate note with the contact**  
  - **Associate Note with Contact in HubSpot** ‚Äì Links the generated note to the correct HubSpot contact.

- **Record activity in tracker sheet**  
  - **Log to Google Sheets** ‚Äì Appends processed cart fields including items, totals, timestamps, and customer info.

## Why use this?
- Identifies high-value or long-abandoned carts automatically and follows up without manual effort.  
- Keeps CRM records updated and adds contextual notes sales teams can act on.  
- Maintains a structured audit trail of every abandoned cart interaction.  
- Improves recovery chances by combining email outreach with CRM enrichment and logging.  
- Enables analysis of abandoned checkout patterns directly from Google Sheets.

parameters.message:
=Hi {{ $json.firstName }},

We noticed you didn‚Äôt get a chance to complete your checkout, and your selected items are still waiting for you.

Take another look whenever you‚Äôre ready ‚Äî your cart has been saved, so it‚Äôll be quick and easy to finish up.

If you have any questions or need help along the way, just reply to this email ‚Äî we‚Äôre always happy to assist.

={{ $('Filter Qualified Carts').item.json.firstName }} {{ $('Filter Qualified Carts').item.json.lastName }} started a checkout on {{ $('Filter Qualified Carts').item.json.createdAt }}, about {{ $('Filter Qualified Carts').item.json.hoursSinceCreated }} hours ago. 
They added {{ $('Filter Qualified Carts').item.json.lineItems[0].quantity }} item ‚Äî ‚Äú{{ $('Filter Qualified Carts').item.json.lineItems[0].title }}‚Äù ‚Äî to their cart with a total value of {{ $('Filter Qualified Carts').item.json.cartTotal }}, but haven‚Äôt completed the purchase yet.

A follow-up email is sent regarding the same

nodes.name: Associate Note with Contact in HubSpot

parameters.content:
## Step 1: Capture & Filter Carts  
Collects new checkout data from Shopify, extracts customer and cart details, and filters carts that are older than 12 hours and worth more than $50. Only qualified carts continue.

## Step 2: Recovery Email & CRM Sync  
Sends a personalized reminder email, updates or creates the customer in HubSpot, generates a detailed activity note, and links it to their contact profile for the sales team.

## Step 3: Log Recovery Data  
Saves all cart and customer details to Google Sheets, including timestamps, item name, quantity, value, and cart age‚Äîhelping track recovery performance.

## Abandoned Cart Recovery & CRM Logging ‚Äì Overview  
This workflow helps you follow up with customers who start checkout but don‚Äôt complete it. It checks if their cart is older than 12 hours and worth more than $50. If it qualifies, the workflow sends a reminder email, updates the customer in HubSpot, adds a note with their cart details, and logs everything in Google Sheets for tracking.

### How it works
- Detects new Shopify checkout  
- Filters high-value, older carts  
- Sends a recovery email  
- Updates customer + adds note in HubSpot  
- Logs details to Google Sheets  

### Setup steps
1. Connect Shopify, Gmail, HubSpot, and Google Sheets  
2. Add your HubSpot token  
3. Select your Google Sheet  
4. Adjust cart filter rules if needed  
5. Test with a sample checkout

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
